text: Such a great game. I still got my very same copy since I was a kid. Loving it still. Castlevania games still rock. So glad I found this game.
author: TrueHolyRune

text: An absolutely haunting and amazing piece. I play this piece sometimes on my Fender Rhodes electric piano and use my MicroKorg synthesizer for the string parts. God, what I would give to hear this played by a symphony orchestra.

text: My  2nd favorite castlevania game ever,such a masterpiece,then below its Castlevania Rondo of Blood another awesome game right there
author: yoguidude

text: Favorite tracks are "Forest of Monsters", "Dracula Battle" and of course "The Submerged City" (awesome Wayne Shorterish track).
author: Erik

text:
Awesome taste, as always.
This is also my favorite CV-game. May have something to do with it being one of the first games i played. And as a little kid interested in mythology and monsters there was basically nothing better.
If you then add to the fact that Super CV IV possesses the best score of any CV-game, well, then you've got a winner!
I like how the composer actually knows how to write good basslines with great rhythms and modulation.
author: Erik

author: Pander8874

text: You know I never really used to like old SNES sound chip -- I thought it sounded a bit too clean, sanitized, and generic compared to earlier sound chips with more square waves and harsher tones -- but these days I seem to really appreciate it. I feel SCIV's soundtrack probably shows off its unique musical strengths the most. Super Metroid does well in this regard, too.
author: DeBurgo

text: While I didn't particularly care for this song or area in the game, it had unrivaled atmosphere.  I'm surprised by the work that went into stage 3.  There are three completely different areas each with a different song.  That is dedication to a good game right there.
author: SMRPGFAN101

text: Kind of depressing... but of unrivaled atmosphere.
